channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024040130
item.description:
Report E-2024040130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured by the shipper's skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, cleaners, absorbents, and a sprayer unit to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040101
item.description:
Report E-2024040101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of regulated UN1263 "Activator - Mid Temp" was released from a one-gallon metal pail due to being punctured by a forklift during dock operations impacting Dock #155. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged metal pail, PPE, and impacted Oil Dri was containerized in one (1) 30-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040107
item.description:
Report E-2024040107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1992 Activ-8 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup of the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30 -gallons of product released to the entire trailer floor and a 15’ x 10’ area of the asphalt and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed to clean the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE were then containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040076
item.description:
Report E-2024040076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: MAPLE HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately sixteen (16) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and patched the damaged tote. The crew conducted a tote transfer and swept up the spent absorbents. All impacted material was containerized in eight (8) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal. The damaged 330-gallon tote and transferred tote of product were taken back to the terminal.

item.title: Report E-2024040039
item.description:
Report E-2024040039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: FINDLAY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted dock door floor. The damaged drum and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon overpack and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030268
item.description:
Report E-2024030268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/07/2024, at 1232 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge, OH yard, discovered CHIU 258609, a loaded container of Waste Environmentally Hazardous Substance Solid N.O.S. (Benzene, Mercury UN3077 Class 9), leaking. The container was isolated and the shipper, Clean Harbors, notified. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the container leaking from the door seam. It was presumed the release was due to a combination of an ineffective door seem and either a failure, or improper installation, of the box’s poly ethylene liner. Contractor personnel secured the package by applying additional sealant to the rear door of the container. The container was removed from the rail transportation and transported offsite via highway by the shipper. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Angel Villa 972-533-4154).

item.title: Report E-2024040043
item.description:
Report E-2024040043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the container being impacted by a sharp object while unloading, approximately 5 gallons of MAT 50 Paint Thinner (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged jerrican, and oil-dri were placed into an 8 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
